body.p:
Greenville Ky 19 May 1862
His Excellency Gov Magoffin
Dear Sir

At the present Term of my Court Edmond Drake & Ben P Wells of this County were Indicted for Gaming on the 9th day May 1862, The facts are as inferred by Credible persons that on that day these two, young men were engaged with many others in working a public road in said County & whilst the hands were resting on the road side they innocently threw up few grains of Corn & did bet on them 5 cents which was won by Wells & then immediately returned to Drake by Wells, The Indictment erroneously charges it to have been done with cards but such is not the fact. In consideration of the facts, the tender age of the parties & the perfect innocency of the parties not thinking or intending at the time to violate any law. I hereby most respectfully ask your Excellency to remit said offence & free them from any further prosecution for the law

Very Ress
Your Obt Servt
Tho, C, Dabney

Muhlenberg Cir Ct
Indictments for Gaming
E Burk & B. P. Wells
Iss May 28 1862
